title.narrative: Assistance Project for Flooded Communities in Northern Mali

description.narrative: The current project is a response to the immediate hygiene, sanitation, and shelter needs of the affected population of Diré, in the Timbuktu region of Mali, who survived the floods of late August 2019. The project will distribute tents and tarpaulins, covering the immediate shelter needs of the populations that have lost their homes as well as free up the schools that people have been seeking shelter in - this will allow children to go back to school by the scheduled start date as the schools are currently occupied by affected populations. Temporary learning spaces will be set up in schools that have lost parts of infrastructure in the floods, which will also allow the timely return to school of children. Latrines will be constructed or rebuilt in two schools. NFI kits will be distributed to cover basic water, sanitation, and hygiene needs. Distributions will be done with complementary messaging about the dangers of stagnant water/puddles and the prevention of waterborne diseases. Finally, cash for work will be given to to allow community members to participate in the construction of shelter to increase community ownership, dignity, as well as provide some income for food assistance and other basic needs. All these activities are planned to be in line with the recommendations of the needs assessments in which Plan Mali participated.
